intro: Aulomyrcia inaequiloba, commonly known as the unequal-lobed fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, asymmetrical leaf lobes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, with a subtle fragrance that attracts pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
